abstract: Closings and renovations of golf courses in Florida, state with most golf course in country, illustrate challenges facing industry as player base continues significant decline; many courses have had to offer members greater amenities, while others have sought bankruptcy protection and still others have slipped into foreclosure.
lead_paragraph: The National Golf Foundation says there are four million fewer golfers than a decade ago. Yet at some communities, homes can go for $5 million.

headline.main: Fewer Golfers, but Some Lush Courses Are Coming Back
headline.print_headline: Golf Courses Forced to Reach Into Bag of Tricks

snippet: The National Golf Foundation says there are four million fewer golfers than a decade ago. Yet at some communities, homes can go for $5 million.
